attributes.action: We need to stop the expansion of the ULEZ
attributes.additional_details: Because this is another tax at a time of cost of living crisis and one that is unfair. If the bus networks out of London could cope that's fine but they cannot just look at the problems in Bromley borough.
attributes.background: Stop the mayor from imposing the ULEZ extension, outer London is fine but to do this will not help people in boroughs with poor bus networks. It's a tax and nothing more. He also said he would listen to those he consulted and hasn't

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Revoke local government powers to charge CAZ, LEZ, ZEZ and ULEZ: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618266
